subject: PrivilegedAccessor Object Array Cannot Contain "null" Value?

Hello,
   I'm running into this problem where the PrivilegedAccessor cannot=
 
find the method when using invokeMethod() if the Object array 
contains a=
 null value.

Ex:

PrivilegedAccessor.invokeMethod(Class.class,"myMethod",n=
ew Object[]
{null,arg1});

I think the problem lies in the fact that undern=
eath, invokeMethod's 
calling getMethod which calls another getMethod, whic=
h ultimately 
calls java.lang.getDeclaredMethod() which only accepts an arr=
ay of 
classes.  Since null is not a class, it throws an exception and thus=
 
the private method is declared not found.  Am I right?  Or am I 
missing =
something?

When I replaced the null with a valid object, it was able to fi=
nd the 
private method fine.  Is this a bug, or is this something that I 
s=
houldn't be doing (setting null as an element in the Object array?).

Thank=
s!
Kris.
